src_text: Ikonomi Kabinete e kopane go buisana ka maemo a ikonomi le merero e e amang tekanyetsokab Kabinete e ne ya amogela dintlha tse dintsi tse di amang ikonomi ya nagMaemo go ralala lefatshe a koafetse mo dikgweding tse di fetilen Kgolo e e bokoa ya lefatshe lotlhe e supa tiragatso e e bokoa le dikotsi tse di kwa godimo mo dinageng tse di botlhokwa tse di tlhabologang, go akaretsa ChinPoelomannong e e amogelegang e e solofelwang kwa USA e ka baka tlhatlogo ya dieelo tsa morokotso go ralala lefatsh Methamo e e ka fa tlase ga kgatelelo ya kgwebisano le maemo a a sa iketlang mo mebarakeng ya lefatshe ya matlole di gatelela tlhokego ya gore dit haba di tlhome tsepamo le go gata ka tlhoafalo mo dipakeng tse di latelanKabinete e ne gape ya amogela gore go na le dipoelo dingwe tse di siameng ka ntlha ya tlhwatlhwa e e kwa tlase ya oli e e sa tlhotlhiwan Jaaka moromelantle wa diphatlho o mogolo, Aforikaborwa e tlhobaediwa ke bokoa bo bo tswelelang ba ditlhwatlhwa tsa diphatlhPuso e tswelela go agelela mo maemong a ikonomi ya naga a mefutafuta, le dipoelo tsa thomelontle di tswelela go ikaega go le gontsi ka dimetale le dire tse di tlhotlhilweng go se kaGo wa ga ditlhwatlhwa tsa diphatlho go ka se dirologe ka bonak Se se tla nna le ditlamorago tse di tla tswelelang mo ikonoming ya Aforika Borwa le tsa dinaga tse dingwe tse dintsi tse e leng balekane ba rona mo kontinenteng ya AforikKwelotlase ya Ranta mo dingwageng di le mmalwa tse di fetileng e tlamela ka dit hono tse di botoka tsa kgolo ya thomelontle mme, mmogo le tlhwatlhwa e e kwa tlase ya oli, e thusitse go fokotsa kgatelelo mo akhaontong ya matlole ya nag Le fa go le jalo, kgolo e e bokoa mo balekaneng ba Aforika Borwa ba kgwebisano e kaya topo e e fokotsegileng ya ditlhagiswa tsa Aforika Borwa kwa dinageng tse dingwMaemo a lefatshe a tsewa a gwetlha mo mebarakeng e e alogang, ka ditlhwatlhwa tse di kwa tlase tsa diphatlho le go gagamadiwa ga pholisi ya dit helete kwa USA e leng se se beileng kgatelelo mo kelelong ya madi le ditsholofelo tsa kgol Se, se bakile ketsaetsego mo mebarakeng ya madRanta ya Aforika Borwa, e leng lengwe la madi a mebaraka e e alogang le go gwebisanwang thata ka lona, e utlwisitswe botlhoko, segolo mo dibekeng tse di sa tswang go fetMo maemong a a bokete a a lefatshe, a mo go ona diikonomi tsotlhe di lebaganeng le dikgwetlho tse dikgolo, Kabinete e gateletse tlhokego ya gore puso e tsereganye ka botlhale le ka go tsaya tshwetso go busetsa segalo sa kgolo ya ikonom Leanotlhabololo la Boset haba (NDP) le tlamela ka ditsereganyo ts Puso e tla golagana le balekane ba loago, segolo kgwebo le mekgatlo ya badiri, go bopa tumalano mo dikgatong tse di kopanetsweng tse di tlhokegang go tsepamisa ikonomi, go bopa tshepo, go tsholetsa maemo a peeletso le poelo mo Aforika Borwa go ya ntlheng ya kgolo ya ikonomi e e akaretsan Puo ya Maemo a Set haba (SoNA) ka 11 Tlhakole e tla tsaya tsia tiro
trg_text: EconomyCabinet met to deliberate on the state of the economy and budget related matter Cabinet noted a number of factors impacting on the economy of the countrThe global outlook has deteriorated in recent month Slower global growth reflects, in particular, weaker performance and higher risks in several important developing countries, including ChinThe welcomed recovery expected in the USA is likely to result in rising global interest rate Depressed trade volumes and turbulence in global capital markets underscore the need for nations to build resilience and act cautiously in the period aheaCabinet further noted that there were some benefits from the low price of crude oi

src_text: Kabinete e tiisitse mekgwa e e maatla ya go busetsa tsela e e isegang ya matlole go lebilwe koafalo e e nnileng teng mo ikonoming ya lefatshe le ditlamorago tsa yona mo ga Tona ya Matlotlo, Pravin Gordhan, o tla ribolola ditsela tse fa a ala tekanyetsokabo ya boset haba ka 24 Tlhakole 201 Tlamelo ka matlole go Thuto e KgolwaneKabinete e amogetse diphetolo mo dikabong tsa tekanyetsokabo ya boset haba tse di tla fetisang matlole go thusa diyunibesithi ntle le go fetisa ditekanyetso tse di begilweng tsa tirisong ya matlolMoporesitente Jacob Zuma le Tona ya Thuto e Kgolwane le Katiso, Blade Nzimande, go sa le gale ba supile gore dikabo tse di tla dirisediwa gore dituelo di se tlhatlosiwe jaaka go dumelanwe mo ngwageng wa ga jaana wa dithuto, go phimola sekoloto sa baithuti sa Sekema sa Thuso ya Matlole sa Baithuti sa Boset haba le go thibela kokotsego ya sekoloto se mo pakagaren
trg_text: As a major commodity exporter, South Africa is concerned about the continued weakness in commodity priceGovernment continues to build on the country s diverse economic structure, and export earnings continue to depend to a great extent on metals and semi processed raw materialThe fall in commodity prices is unlikely to reverse speedil This will have sustained consequences for the South African economy and many of our partners on the African continenThe depreciation of the Rand over the last few years offers much better prospects for export growth and, combined with a lower global oil price, has helped to relieve pressure on the current accoun However, weaker growth in South Africa s major trading partners has meant subdued demand for South African products abroaThe global environment is regarded as particularly challenging for emerging markets, with lower commodity prices and tightening of monetary policy in the USA putting pressure on capital flows and growth expectation This has translated into significant volatility in capital marketThe South African Rand, which is amongst the most traded emerging market currencies, has been particularly hard-hit in recent weekIn this difficult global context, in which all economies face difficult challenges, Cabinet reaffirmed the need for government to intervene strategically and more decisively to restore the momentum of economic growt The National Development Plan provides for these intervention Government will reach out to social partners, particularly business and organised labour, to build consensus on the collective actions required to stabilise the economy, build confidence, raise the level of investment and return South Africa to a path of inclusive economic growt The State of the Nation Address on 11 February will take account of this wor Cabinet endorsed stronger measures to restore a sustainable fiscal path, taking account of the weakened outlook for the global economy and its domestic consequence Finance Minister Pravin Gordhan will unveil the measures when he presents the national budget on 24 February 201 Higher Education fundingCabinet approved amendments to national budget allocations that would shift resources to fund universities without breaching previously announced spending limitPresident Jacob Zuma and Higher Education and Training Minister Blade Nzimande recently indicated that these allocations would cover the zero-fee increment agreed for the current academic year, clear accumulated debt owed by the National Student Financial Aid Scheme (NSFAS) students and prevent the accumulation of such debt over the medium ter

src_text: Mekgwa e ya tsereganyo ke tsibogo ya ditherisano di le mmalwa tse di simolotseng ka Diphalane 2015 e bile di santse di tswelel Tona ya Thuto e Kgolwane le Katiso le setlhopha sa gagwe sa bolaodi o tshwere dikopano di le mmalwa le boeteledipele ba SASCO, Makgotla a Dikemedi tsa Baithuti otlhe, Foramo ya Diyunibesithi tsa Aforika Borwa, Kopano ya Baithuti ba Aforika Borwa, boCEO ba diSETA, Mokgatlo wa Tlhabololo ya Thuto e Kgolwane le komiti ya Palamente e e nang le maikarabelo a thuto e kgolwan
trg_text: These funds are additional to the R10 billion that NSFAS will administer in the 2016 academic yeaGovernment is committed to providing post-school education for all academically deserving students that is free at the point of delivery for the poor and the working class, within fiscally sustainable limit Cabinet calls on students, workers, academics and university administrators to work together with government to achieve this goa Actions that disrupt learning or create unreasonable and practically unachievable expectations are counterproductiv Violence and intimidation are not acceptabl Cabinet calls on all South Africans to recognize that there are challenging circumstances in the period ahea Global economic conditions have weakene The impact of lower commodity prices is already being felt in South Afric Domestic constraints such as insufficient electricity supply are still with u The severe drought is causing hardships in several provinceCabinet is confident that South Africans remain as a resilient nation that knows the value of working together in peace and harmon The recent exposure of individuals with racist s beliefs has strengthen our collective commitment to build a nonracial, nonsexist and prosperous societ

src_text: Moporesitente o kopane gape le boeteledipele ba baithuti e bile o ba begetse ka go tlhongwa ga Khomi ene e e tla lebang dintlha tse di tlhagisitsweng ka ga Thuto e Kgolwan Ditherisano tse di santse di tswelela pele gonne re dumela gore jaaka puso re batla go dira go bona tharabololo ya lerur Ditopo tsa baithuti di nyalana le maitlhomo a thulaganyo ya puso tebang le thuto Mo maemong a ga jaana, dibilione tsa diranta tse
trg_text: with his management team has held a number of meetings with SASCO leadership, all Student Representative Councils, University South Africa Forum , South African Union of Students, the CEO s of SETA s , Higher Education Transformation Network and the Parliamentary committee responsible for higher educatioThe President also met with the leadership of the students and has announced the setting up of the Commission to look into the issues raised in Higher Educatio These engagements are still continuing as we believe as government we do want to work towards finding a lasting solutio The demands of the students are in line with the objectives of the programme of government in respect of education As an immediate measure, R billion has been allocated to resolve the shortfall in operational funding for universities as a result of the agreement on a 0% fee increment for 201 In the 2016/17 financial year, government has reprioritized R3 billion of State funding to be allocated to NSFAS to provide loans to assist 71 753 identified students who qualified for NSFAS funding but were either partially or not funded at all over the past three academic year This means that these deserving students will not be prevented from continuing with their studies for owing universities outstanding fees A further R9 billion will be allocated to NSFAS in the 2016/17 financial year to support unfunded or under-funded students still in the university system in 2016 to complete their qualification

src_text: di abetswe go samagana le tlhaelo mo go tlameleng diyunibesithi ka matlole ka ntlha ya tumalano ya koketso ya dituelo ka 0% ka 201 Mo ngwageng wa dit helete wa 2016/17, puso e abile se wa dibilione tsa diranta di le 3 tsa matlole a Puso go abelwa NSFAS go tlamela ka dikadimo tsa go thusa baithuti ba ba supilweng ke NSFAS ba le 71 753 mme ba ne ba tlametswe ka seripa fela kgotsa ba sa tlamelwa gotlhelele ka matlole mo dingwageng di le tharo tse di fetileng tsa dithut Se se kaya gore baithuti ba ba tshwanelwang ba, ba ka se ganediwe go tsweletsa dithuto tsa bona ka ntlha ya fa ba na le dikoloto tse di saletseng morago tsa diyunibesithi Dibilione tse dingwe tsa diranta di le 9 di abetswe NSFAS mo ngwageng wa dit helete wa 2016/17 go tshegetsa baithuti ba ba senang matlole kgotsa ba matlole a a tlhaelang ba ba santseng ba le mo diyunibesithing ka 2016 go konosetsa dithuto tsa bon
trg_text: AppointmentsCabinet approved the following appointments: Mr Shonisani Mathews Munzhedzi as Deputy Director-General (DDG): Biodiversity and Conservation in the Department of Environmental Affair Ms Siphokazi Ndudane as DDG: Fisheries Management in the Department of Agriculture, Forestry and FisherieEnquiries:Phumla Williams (Acting Cabinet Spokesperson)Cell: 083 501 0139

src_text: Matlole a ke tlaleletso mo godimo ga dibilione tsa diranta di le 10 tse NSFAS e tla di rebolang mo ngwageng wa dithuto wa 2016.Puso e ineetse go tlamela ka thuto ya morago ga sekolo, go baithuti botlhe ba ba tshwanelwang, ya mahala go batlhoki le ba maemo a a kwa tlase a badiri, mo teng ga ditekanyetso tse di diregang tsa matlol Kabinete e ikuela go baithuti, badiri, batlhatlheledi le batsamaisi ba diyunibesithi go dirisana mmogo le puso go fitlhelela maikaelelo Dikgato tse di kgoreletsang dithuto kgotsa di tlholang maemo a a sa iketlang kgotsa go solofela dilo tse di ka se fitlhelelegeng, ga di na thuso ep Tirisodikgoka le matshosetsi ga di amogeleg Kabinete e ikuela go maAforika Borwa otlhe go lemoga gore go na le maemo a a gwetlhang mo pakeng e e tlan Maemo a ikonomi ya lefatshe a koafets Seabe sa ditlhwatlhwa tse di kwa tlase tsa diphatlho se setse se utlwala mo Aforika Borw Mathata a selegae jaaka tlamelo e e sa lekanang ya motlakase, a santse a le ten Komelelo e kgolo e baka mathata mo diporofenseng di le mmalwKabinete e na le bonnete ba gore maAforika Borwa a tswelela go nna set haba se se maatla se se itseng boleng ba go dira mmogo ka kagiso le kutlwan Go senoga ga se weng ga batho ba ditumelo tsa go tlhaola ka mmala go maatlafaditse boineelo ba rona rotlhe ba go aga set haba se se sa tlhaoleng go ya ka mmala, ka bong mme e le set haba se se tswelelan
trg_text: These intervention measures are a response to a number of consultations which started in October 2015 and are still continuin The Minister of Higher Education and training
